subject: Re: [junit] Do You Want to Skip Test Methods?
msgSnippet: I would like to have this feature as well, BUT I have one minor objection to the idea. The proposed solution to add _ignored after the test method
messageBody:
I would like to have this feature as well, BUT I have one minor objection
to the idea. The proposed solution to add "_ignored" after the test method
declaration will still have problems with other Test runners, since they
look for "public void test*" (right?). Even if I use the vladimir testrunner
some other might use the normal textui runner, that still uses the
ignored testcase and hence it seems that the source is broken.

Wouldnt it be better to add the "ignored" in front of the test method name,
as "public void ignored_testMultipleSets()"?


The downside will be that the testcase might be forgotten if people stop
use the special testrunner, since it doenst pop up in the normal testrunners...
hmm..

//Erik

----- Original Message -----
From: "Bill Venners" <bv@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Friday, April 25, 2003 1:54 AM
Subject: [junit] Do You Want to Skip Test Methods?


> Hello All,
>
> I'm curious how many JUnit users want a way to temporarily mark certain
> test methods so that the runner doesn't execute them, but reports that
> they are skipped. This is a functionality that Vladimir R. Bossicard
> provides via his JUnit Add-Ons runner, which he describes in his first
> blog post:
>
> http://www.artima.com/weblogs/viewpost.jsp?thread=4603
>
> I'm considering whether or not it makes sense to do something similar
> for SuiteRunner, and I'd like to know what JUnit users would really
> want. If you do want something like this, for what specific use cases
> do you imagine you'd use it?
>
> Thanks.
>
> Bill
> --
> Bill Venners
> Artima Software, Inc.
> http://www.artima.com
